page.title: 05COMMUNICATIONS AND HINXWORTH
page.content: In many ways we are very self- reliant in this area, we have to be, as there is only one delivery of post per day and two collections on weekdays but mainly because we no longer have a Post Office. Early in 1984 the facility whereby on Thursday mornings for three hours a local lady would operate a mobile Post office in the village hall, primarily for the elderly to collect their pensions, was withdrawn despite strenuous protest - it was regarded as "uneconomic". This has therefore caused a major problem for some people who do not have cars of their own and cannot easily get to nearby towns. They are often reliant on generous neighbours to give them lifts since the bus service also operates on a very limited basis.There "is still a telephone kiosk in the High Street but it may be under threat!
